actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of Senate amendments to H.R. 622. Resolution provides for a single motion that the House concur in each of the Senate amendments to H.R. 622 with a further amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying the resolution.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-359, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 124.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 347.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 207 (Roll no. 36).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 206 (Roll no. 37).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 622) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the adoption credit, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 622 (adoption tax credits expansion and temporary extended unemployment compensation).

titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 622) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the adoption credit, and for other purposes.
